ESB Mark Styling Examples

The following example shows the most common use cases for styling. This is by no means a comprehensive guide for what can be done to style a Frame.

Default Style

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit. Nulla dolor, nisi quis quod! Quam laudantium, unde at neque porro numquam, similique ut enim natus commodi totam non. Accusamus odio, neque!

						
<p data-esb-mark>
    Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit. Nulla dolor, nisi quis quod! 
    Quam laudantium, unde at neque porro numquam, similique ut enim natus commodi totam 
    non. Accusamus odio, neque!
</p>

Basic Style Override (Color, Font, Outline style, etc.)

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit. Nulla dolor, nisi quis quod! Quam laudantium, unde at neque porro numquam, similique ut enim natus commodi totam non. Accusamus odio, neque!

html - includes Google Font Reference 
						
<html>
    <head>
        <link href='http://fonts.googleapis.com/css?family=Oswald' rel='stylesheet' type='text/css'>
        <link rel="stylesheet" href="/path/to/esb.min.css"/>
        <link rel="stylesheet" href="my-esb-mark-overrides.css">
        <script src="/path/to/esb.min.js"></script>
    </head>
    <body>
        <p data-esb-mark="Body Copy">
            Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit. Nulla dolor, nisi quis quod! 
            Quam laudantium, unde at neque porro numquam, similique ut enim natus commodi totam 
            non. Accusamus odio, neque!
        </p>
    </body>
</html>
my-esb-mark-overrides.css 
						
.esb-mark-label {
    background: skyblue;
    border-radius: 10px;
    font-family: 'Oswald', sans-serif;
    padding: 2px 10px;
    opacity: 0.9;
}

.esb-mark:hover .esb-mark-label {
    opacity: 1;
}

.esb-mark--has-outline {
    outline: solid 3px skyblue;
}

.esb-mark--has-outline:hover {
    outline-width: 5px;
}

.esb-mark-label-id {
    color: black;
}

.esb-mark-label-name {
    text-transform: uppercase;
}
